result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
3:44 PM Defendant STEPHEN J HAIGHT appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephanie M. Rock appeared by video for STEPHEN J HAIGHT.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing via zoom. Court goes over right to appear next to his attorney and right to a break-out room if he needs to talk with his attorney. Defendant requests to talk with his attorney. Court recess at 3:45 PM. Court recalls case at 3:57 PM. Appearances remain the same. State has one witness.

Michael Majeske sworn, direct by ADA McElroy, is employed as a Patrol Deputy for the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. Was employed on the date in question. Testimony given. Venue established. Identified the defendant present in court. Cross exam by Atty Rock. Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony has been committed and that the felony probably was committed by the defendant and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court, adds the PAC to it and copy to Atty Rock. Attorney Rock waives any reading. Atty Rock enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court will set for Return Date on December 5, 2022 at 10:30 AM. 

Court adjourned at 4:05 PM
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely (emailed to Marquette Co Jail)

Adjustment Number: 22A 011539,
Payable Number: 69076,
Receipt Number: 22R 003144,
Amount: $20.00

NOT ON THE RECORD

Defendant STEPHEN J HAIGHT in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Stephanie Rock appears for the def and states she'll be filing a notice of retainer soon. Court sets for Preliminary Hearing Sep 20, 2022 at 3:30. (30 min).
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 20, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

10:01 AM Defendant STEPHEN J HAIGHT in court.  Attorney Gerise Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  DA makes statement re: bond and absolute sobriety. Court orders bodn to remain and adds Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance if it is not a condition. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits. Court will set for Status of Counsel on August 2, 2022 at 10:00 Am.

Court adjourned at 10:04 AM
Second appearance scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
